10#include "src/execution/isolate.h"

16namespace v8 {
17namespace internal {
18
19// Mechanism for associating an ExternalPointerTag with a C++ type that is
20// referenced via a Managed. Every such C++ type must have a unique
21// ExternalPointerTag to ensure type-safe access to the external object.
22//
23// This mechanism supports two ways of associating tags with types:
24//
25// 1. By adding a 'static constexpr ExternalPointerTag kManagedTag` field to
26// the C++ class (preferred for C++ types defined in V8 code):
27//
28// class MyCppClass {
29// public:
30// static constexpr ExternalPointerTag kManagedTag = kMyCppClassTag;
31// ...;
32//
33// 2. Through the ASSIGN_EXTERNAL_POINTER_TAG_FOR_MANAGED macro, which uses
34// template specialization (necessary for C++ types defined outside of V8):
35//
36// ASSIGN_EXTERNAL_POINTER_TAG_FOR_MANAGED(MyCppClass, kMyCppClassTag)
37//
38// Note that the struct created by this macro must be visible when the
39// Managed<CppType> is used. In particular, there may be issues if the
40// CppType is only forward declared and the respective header isn't included.
41// Note also that this macro must be used inside the v8::internal namespace.
42//
43template <typename CppType>
44struct TagForManaged {
45 static constexpr ExternalPointerTag value = CppType::kManagedTag;
46};
47
48#define ASSIGN_EXTERNAL_POINTER_TAG_FOR_MANAGED(CppType, Tag) \
49 template <> \
50 struct TagForManaged<CppType> { \
51 static constexpr ExternalPointerTag value = Tag; \
52 };
53
54// Implements a doubly-linked lists of destructors for the isolate.
55struct ManagedPtrDestructor
56#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
57 : public ExternalPointerTable::ManagedResource {
58#else
59 : public Malloced {
60#endif // V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
61
62 // Estimated size of external memory associated with the managed object.
63 // This is used to adjust the garbage collector's heuristics upon
64 // allocation and deallocation of a managed object.
65 size_t estimated_size_ = 0;
66 ManagedPtrDestructor* prev_ = nullptr;
67 ManagedPtrDestructor* next_ = nullptr;
68 void* shared_ptr_ptr_ = nullptr;
69 void (*destructor_)(void* shared_ptr) = nullptr;
70 Address* global_handle_location_ = nullptr;
71
72 ManagedPtrDestructor(size_t estimated_size, void* shared_ptr_ptr,
73 void (*destructor)(void*))
74 : estimated_size_(estimated_size),
75 shared_ptr_ptr_(shared_ptr_ptr),
76 destructor_(destructor) {}
77};
78
79// The GC finalizer of a managed object, which does not depend on
80// the template parameter.
81V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void ManagedObjectFinalizer(
82 const v8::WeakCallbackInfo<void>& data);
83
84// {Managed<T>} is essentially a {std::shared_ptr<T>} allocated on the heap
85// that can be used to manage the lifetime of C++ objects that are shared
86// across multiple isolates.
87// When a {Managed<T>} object is garbage collected (or an isolate which
88// contains {Managed<T>} is torn down), the {Managed<T>} deletes its underlying
89// {std::shared_ptr<T>}, thereby decrementing its internal reference count,
90// which will delete the C++ object when the reference count drops to 0.
91template <class CppType>
92class Managed : public Foreign {
93 public:
94 Managed() : Foreign() {}
95 explicit Managed(Address ptr) : Foreign(ptr) {}
96 explicit V8_INLINE constexpr Managed(Address ptr, SkipTypeCheckTag)
97 : Foreign(ptr, SkipTypeCheckTag{}) {}
98
99 // For every object, add a `->` operator which returns a pointer to this
100 // object. This will allow smoother transition between T and Tagged<T>.
101 Managed* operator->() { return this; }
102 const Managed* operator->() const { return this; }
103
104 // Get a raw pointer to the C++ object.
105 V8_INLINE CppType* raw() { return GetSharedPtrPtr()->get(); }
106
107 // Get a reference to the shared pointer to the C++ object.
108 V8_INLINE const std::shared_ptr<CppType>& get() { return *GetSharedPtrPtr(); }
109
110 static Tagged<Managed> cast(Tagged<Object> obj) {
111 return Tagged<Managed>(Managed(obj.ptr()).ptr());
112 }
113 static constexpr Tagged<Managed> unchecked_cast(Tagged<Object> obj) {
114 return Tagged<Managed>(obj.ptr());
115 }
116
117 // Allocate a new {CppType} and wrap it in a {Managed<CppType>}.
118 template <typename... Args>
119 static Handle<Managed<CppType>> Allocate(Isolate* isolate,
120 size_t estimated_size,
121 Args&&... args);
122
123 // Create a {Managed<CppType>} from an existing raw {CppType*}. The returned
124 // object will now own the memory pointed to by {CppType}.
125 static Handle<Managed<CppType>> FromRawPtr(Isolate* isolate,
126 size_t estimated_size,
127 CppType* ptr);
128
129 // Create a {Managed<CppType>} from an existing {std::unique_ptr<CppType>}.
130 // The returned object will now own the memory pointed to by {CppType}, and
131 // the unique pointer will be released.
132 static Handle<Managed<CppType>> FromUniquePtr(
133 Isolate* isolate, size_t estimated_size,
134 std::unique_ptr<CppType> unique_ptr,
135 AllocationType allocation_type = AllocationType::kYoung);
136
137 // Create a {Managed<CppType>} from an existing {std::shared_ptr<CppType>}.
138 static Handle<Managed<CppType>> FromSharedPtr(
139 Isolate* isolate, size_t estimated_size,
140 std::shared_ptr<CppType> shared_ptr,
141 AllocationType allocation_type = AllocationType::kYoung);
142
143 private:
144 friend class Tagged<Managed>;
145
146 // Internally this {Foreign} object stores a pointer to a new
147 // std::shared_ptr<CppType>.
148 std::shared_ptr<CppType>* GetSharedPtrPtr() {
149 static constexpr ExternalPointerTag kTag = TagForManaged<CppType>::value;
150 auto destructor =
151 reinterpret_cast<ManagedPtrDestructor*>(foreign_address<kTag>());
152 return reinterpret_cast<std::shared_ptr<CppType>*>(
153 destructor->shared_ptr_ptr_);
154 }
155
156 // Called by either isolate shutdown or the {ManagedObjectFinalizer} in order
157 // to actually delete the shared pointer and decrement the shared refcount.
158 static void Destructor(void* ptr) {
159 auto shared_ptr_ptr = reinterpret_cast<std::shared_ptr<CppType>*>(ptr);
160 delete shared_ptr_ptr;
161 }
162};
163
164} // namespace internal
165} // namespace v8
166
167#endif // V8_OBJECTS_MANAGED_H_
